title: Premier Insurance Offering
summary: The slide presents an insurance offering by Premier, focusing on Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity and Group Accident Insurance. These insurance products are underwritten by the United States Fire Insurance Company and are offered exclusively to NCE members. The slide features an image of three people sitting together, suggesting a focus on community or group benefits.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity and Group Accident Insurance Benefits Overview
summary: This slide provides a detailed overview of the benefits offered under various insurance plans, ranging from the 100 Plan to the 1000+ Plan. Each plan offers different daily benefits for hospital confinement, admissions, intensive care, emergency room visits, surgeries, and diagnostic tests. The benefits vary by plan, with higher plans offering greater coverage amounts. Additionally, there is a group accident benefit for accidental death set at $10,000 across all plans. Hospital admission benefits and emergency room benefits are also outlined, with specific amounts per day depending on the plan. The slide notes that these benefits are available in several states including Alabama, California, and Wisconsin, among others.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Description of Benefits
summary: The slide outlines various benefits available under a hospital fixed indemnity policy, including Hospital Admission Benefit, Daily Hospital Confinement Benefit, Daily Intensive Care/Coronary Care Unit Benefit, Daily Inpatient Surgery Benefit, and Daily Inpatient Surgery Anesthesia Benefit. Each benefit is contingent upon specific conditions such as medical necessity and the occurrence of a covered accident or sickness. The benefits are paid until certain conditions are met, such as the end of hospital stay or the death of the covered person. Additionally, there is a benefit for Emergency Room Visits for Sickness and Injury, which covers emergency room treatment for medical emergencies. The slide also notes that the benefits are subject to terms, conditions, limitations, and exclusions as detailed in the policy.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Description of Benefits
summary: The slide outlines various benefits under a Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity plan. It includes the Daily Outpatient Surgery Benefit, which covers surgeries ordered by a physician due to a covered injury or sickness, performed in outpatient hospital departments or ambulatory surgical centers. The Daily Outpatient Surgery Anesthesia Benefit covers anesthesia for outpatient surgeries. The Daily Physician’s Office Visits Benefit applies when a covered person visits a physician’s office, clinic, or urgent care for necessary treatment. The Daily Inpatient Diagnostic Radiology, X-ray, and Imaging Benefits cover services for confined hospital patients, excluding radiation therapy. Similarly, the Daily Outpatient Diagnostic Radiology, X-ray, and Imaging Benefits cover non-confined patients. The Daily Inpatient Laboratory Test Benefit applies to confined hospital patients, while the Daily Outpatient Laboratory Test Benefit applies to non-confined patients, both requiring physician orders and licensed technician performance.

title: Group Accident Benefits Overview
summary: The slide outlines various benefits available under a group accident policy, including Hospital Admission Benefit, Daily Hospital Confinement Benefit, Daily Intensive Care/Coronary Care Unit Benefit, Daily Physician’s Office Visits Benefit, Daily Emergency Room Visits for Sickness and Injury, Daily Inpatient Surgery Anesthesia Benefit, and Daily Outpatient Surgery Anesthesia Benefit. Each benefit is detailed with conditions under which it is applicable, such as the necessity of medical treatment due to a covered accident or sickness. The benefits are paid based on specific conditions like hospital stay duration, death of the covered person, or policy end date. The ICU/CCU benefit is provided in lieu of the Daily Hospital Confinement benefit.

title: Group Accident Description of Benefits
summary: The slide outlines various benefits related to surgeries, diagnostic radiology, and laboratory tests for covered individuals in the event of an accident or sickness. It details the conditions under which daily inpatient and outpatient surgery benefits are provided, specifying that surgeries must be medically necessary and performed in appropriate medical facilities. Inpatient diagnostic radiology benefits are available when a covered person is hospitalized and tests are ordered by a physician. Outpatient diagnostic radiology benefits apply when the individual is not hospitalized. Similarly, inpatient laboratory test benefits are provided when the person is confined in a hospital, while outpatient laboratory test benefits apply when the person is not hospitalized. All tests must be ordered by a physician and performed by licensed technicians. The slide clarifies that radiation therapy is not included in these benefits.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefit Exclusions
summary: This slide outlines the exclusions for the Limited Fixed Indemnity insurance portion of a membership, detailing scenarios where coverage is not provided. Exclusions include self-inflicted injuries, acts of war, active military service, participation in riots, and injuries from illegal activities. It also excludes treatments for mental illness, substance abuse, and injuries related to alcohol or drug use. Other exclusions cover experimental treatments, services by non-approved medical personnel, and specific medical procedures like gastric bypass and elective abortions. Additionally, injuries from violating policyholder rules, non-standard medical treatments, and certain dental and TMJ treatments are not covered.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefit Exclusions
summary: This slide outlines specific exclusions and limitations for a group hospital fixed indemnity insurance policy. It lists various scenarios and treatments that are not covered, such as treatment for blood or blood plasma, routine vision care, accidents involving unlicensed motor vehicle operators, and travel-related exclusions involving certain types of aircraft and vehicles. Additionally, it specifies that pre-existing conditions are not covered for the first 12 months after the effective date of coverage, applicable to hospital, surgery, and related anesthesia benefits. The slide emphasizes that the insurance is a limited policy and not a substitute for comprehensive medical insurance, highlighting that it does not provide major medical coverage or meet minimum essential benefits as per the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

title: Group Accident Benefit Exclusions
summary: The slide outlines various exclusions from coverage under a Group Accident Benefit Certificate. It specifies that losses resulting from suicide, self-destruction, or intentional self-inflicted injury are not covered. Exclusions also include injuries from war, military service, riots, and illegal activities. Medical exclusions cover treatment for sickness, disease, mental disorders, and injuries sustained while intoxicated or under the influence of drugs. Additional exclusions include injuries covered by other compensation, participation in motorized races, and pre-existing conditions. Specific medical conditions and treatments such as hernias, Osgood-Schlatter's disease, and pregnancy-related issues are also excluded unless directly caused by a covered accident.

title: Group Accident Benefit Exclusions
summary: This slide outlines specific exclusions for group accident benefits, detailing various scenarios and treatments not covered by the policy. Exclusions include expenses for TMJ disorders, certain dental care, blood plasma treatments, and vision-related items like eyeglasses and contact lenses. It also excludes accidents involving unlicensed motor vehicle operation, travel on specific vehicles like snowmobiles and water jet skis, and participation in professional sports. Additionally, the policy does not cover elective or cosmetic surgeries unless for reconstructive purposes, nor does it cover rest cures or custodial care. The slide emphasizes that the insurance is a limited benefit policy, intended to supplement comprehensive health plans, and does not cover sickness or provide major medical coverage.

title: Termination of Insurance
summary: The slide outlines the conditions under which insurance policies terminate for policyholders, insured persons, and dependents. The policy terminates automatically on the earlier of the policy expiration date or the premium due date if not paid. Termination can also occur if the policyholder or company provides written notice at least 60 days prior. Insured persons' coverage ends when they are no longer eligible, report for active duty, or request termination. Dependents' coverage ends when the policy terminates, the insured person's coverage ends, or they are no longer dependents. The slide also includes details about insurance premiums underwritten by United States Fire Insurance Company, specifying different rates for various membership levels and family structures. The premiums reflect only the coverage underwritten by the company and exclude other association costs.

title: NCE Association Membership Overview
summary: The slide provides an overview of the National Congress of Employers (NCE), a national association supporting small and medium-sized businesses in the U.S. by offering services, resources, and benefits. Membership includes both non-insurance benefits and insurance enrollment opportunities. Upon successful application, members receive a confirmation email with a membership handbook and insurance details, and ID cards are mailed within 7-10 business days. The Premier Plan offers limited benefit and accident-only insurance, supplementing but not replacing medical insurance, with specific terms and conditions. Coverage availability may vary by state. Insurance eligibility is for NCE members under age 65 and not eligible for Medicare, with coverage extending to spouses and dependent children under 26. Policies are underwritten by United States Fire Insurance Company.

title: NCE Association Membership Benefits Overview
summary: The slide outlines the benefits of NCE Association membership, emphasizing no waiting periods or pre-existing condition limitations. Members receive discounts on medical, pharmacy, vision, dental, hearing, and alternative care through the First Health Network. The GapAfford Plus program offers savings on medical expenses without deductibles, medical exams, claim forms, usage limitations, age restrictions, or pre-existing condition limitations. Additionally, First Health Network Provider Network Discounts are available, allowing members to save on out-of-pocket costs when using network providers. The network includes practitioners in all 50 states, covering doctors, hospitals, clinics, and laboratories.

title: NCE Association Membership Benefits - GapAfford Plus
summary: The slide outlines various membership benefits under the GapAfford Plus program, including discounts and services across multiple health-related areas. Prescription Discount Benefits offer savings on brand-name and generic medications. The OUTLOOK Vision Network provides discounts on eyeglasses and eye care services. The Aetna Dental Access Network offers savings on dental services without pre-existing condition exclusions or benefit maximums. Pet Rx provides discounts on medications for pets. Hearing Savings Program and Imaging Savings Program offer savings on hearing aids and radiology testing, respectively. Medical Supplies and Equipment discounts range from 20% to 50%. The Laboratory Savings Program provides affordable medical testing services. Physical Therapy offers a 20% savings at numerous locations. Vitamins and Supplements discounts can reach up to 75%. The program also includes 24/7 Health Information Line and Nurse Help Line services.
